reviews.text:
This is a fairly quiet station, receiving around 8 trains an hour, with the direction depending on the time of day. The southbound platform has a disabled entrance, but the northbound platform doesn't. If you can't use stairs and need to travel up to London, take a quick trip to Burgess Hill station, where there is disabled access to both platforms.

As for facilities, there's a toilet, large shelter and the aforementioned disabled access on the southbound platform, while the northbound platform has a couple waiting shelters. There is a manned office here, however it's open times fluctuates. There's also automatic ticket machines and no barriers
Station only has disabled access Southbound. Northbound it's accessed by stairs.
After climbing what feels like a mountain to get to the platforms it"s 50/50 if the ticket office is open. If you need accessible access northbound go to another station.

Twice in 4 months I have paid for a weekly ticket from the machine on the southbound line and no ticket was dispensed. At 05.40 the ticket office is closed. I informed southern to be told the machine shows no fault and the transaction was successful. 
Absolutely disgusted....
Basic station about 6 trains an hour. Wheelchair access on southbound platform only is really inconvenient.
